verses.text_plain: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
1The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the Lord. ▼
▼ preparations: or, disposings

verses.text_plain: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the Lord weigheth the spirits.
verses.verse_html: 2All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the Lord weigheth the spirits.

verses.text_plain: Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.
verses.verse_html:
3Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established. ▼
▼ Commit: Heb. Roll

verses.text_plain: The Lord hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
verses.verse_html: 4The Lord hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.

verses.text_plain: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
verses.verse_html:
5Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished. ▼
▼ unpunished: Heb. held innocent

footnotes.body_html: ▼ unpunished: Heb. held innocent

verses.text_plain: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the Lord men depart from evil.
verses.verse_html: 6By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the Lord men depart from evil.

verses.text_plain: When a man’s ways please the Lord, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
verses.verse_html: 7When a man’s ways please the Lord, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.

verses.text_plain: Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.
verses.verse_html: 8Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.

verses.text_plain: A man’s heart deviseth his way: but the Lord directeth his steps.
verses.verse_html: 9A man’s heart deviseth his way: but the Lord directeth his steps.

verses.text_plain: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.
verses.verse_html:
10A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment. ▼
▼ A divine…: Heb. Divination

footnotes.body_html: ▼ A divine…: Heb. Divination

verses.text_plain: A just weight and balance are the Lord’s: all the weights of the bag are his work.
verses.verse_html:
11A just weight and balance are the Lord’s: all the weights of the bag are his work. ▼
▼ the weights: Heb. the stones

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the weights: Heb. the stones

verses.text_plain: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.
verses.verse_html: 12It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.

verses.text_plain: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.
verses.verse_html: 13Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.

verses.text_plain: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.
verses.verse_html: 14The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.

verses.text_plain: In the light of the king’s countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.
verses.verse_html: 15In the light of the king’s countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.

verses.text_plain: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!
verses.verse_html: 16How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!

verses.text_plain: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.
verses.verse_html: 17The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.

verses.text_plain: Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.
verses.verse_html: 18Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.

verses.text_plain: Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.
verses.verse_html: 19Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.

verses.text_plain: He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the Lord, happy is he.
verses.verse_html:
20He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the Lord, happy is he. ▼
▼ handleth…: or, understandeth a matter

footnotes.body_html: ▼ handleth…: or, understandeth a matter

verses.text_plain: The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
verses.verse_html: 21The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.

verses.text_plain: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.
verses.verse_html: 22Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.

verses.text_plain: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.
verses.verse_html:
23The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips. ▼
▼ teacheth: Heb. maketh wise

footnotes.body_html: ▼ teacheth: Heb. maketh wise

verses.text_plain: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
verses.verse_html: 24Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

verses.text_plain: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
verses.verse_html: 25There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

verses.text_plain: He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.
verses.verse_html:
26He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him. ▼
▼ He…: Heb. The soul of him that
 , ▼
▼ craveth…: Heb. boweth unto him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ He…: Heb. The soul of him that
footnotes.body_html: ▼ He…: Heb. The soul of him that
▼ craveth…: Heb. boweth unto him

verses.text_plain: An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.
verses.verse_html:
27An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire. ▼
▼ An…: Heb. A man of Belial

footnotes.body_text: ▼ An…: Heb. A man of Belial
footnotes.body_html: ▼ An…: Heb. A man of Belial

verses.text_plain: A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
verses.verse_html:
28A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends. ▼
▼ soweth: Heb. sendeth forth

footnotes.body_html: ▼ soweth: Heb. sendeth forth

verses.text_plain: A violent man enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.
verses.verse_html: 29A violent man enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.

verses.text_plain: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
verses.verse_html: 30He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.

verses.text_plain: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.
verses.verse_html: 31The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.

verses.text_plain: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
verses.verse_html: 32He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

verses.text_plain: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 33The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the Lord.
